context_analysis.energy_patterns: Energy level 7/10 indicates good capacity for both physical activity (golf) and focused work (Echo dev). Should leverage morning energy for development before golf.
strategic_priorities: Echo dev on project panel and database
House cleaning before Hunter returns at 10 PM
time_constraints: Must leave by 10:00 for golf warmup
Hunter home at 10 PM - house must be clean

reasoning.scheduling_strategy: Front-load Echo development in early morning when energy and focus are highest (6:00-9:30). Golf commitment creates a hard stop at 10:00. Afternoon reserved for household tasks, strategically ordering them to ensure house is clean well before Hunter's arrival.
reasoning.energy_optimization: Capitalize on morning mental clarity for complex database work. Golf provides active recovery mid-day. Schedule lower-cognitive tasks (cleaning, shopping) for afternoon when energy naturally dips. End with meal planning when mentally refreshed.
reasoning.priority_sequencing: 1) Echo dev first (highest priority + best energy match), 2) Golf (fixed commitment), 3) House cleaning immediately after golf (critical for Hunter's return), 4) Grocery shopping, 5) Meal planning last (can be done relaxed at home)
reasoning.recovery_planning: Golf serves as active recovery between coding and household tasks. Built in transition time after golf for lunch/rest. Evening buffer after all tasks complete allows for relaxation before Hunter arrives.

narrative.summary: I've crafted your schedule around your golf commitment at 11:10 and Hunter's 10 PM return. I prioritized Echo development in the early morning when your energy is fresh - giving you a solid 3.5-hour block for database work before golf. After golf, I've sequenced your household tasks strategically: cleaning first (ensuring it's done well before Hunter arrives), then grocery shopping, and finally meal planning at home. This flow respects your energy patterns while hitting all your objectives.

questions.question: Would you prefer to do meal planning before grocery shopping to create a targeted list?
questions.context: Could save time at the store but requires switching the task order

key_insights: 3.5-hour morning block maximizes high-energy time for Echo development
Golf creates natural break between cognitive and physical tasks
House cleaning scheduled early afternoon ensures completion before Hunter's arrival
5-hour evening buffer provides flexibility and stress-free wind-down
